data.name: Code the word if you are coder!
data.description:
Your task of this kata is to implement the Caesar cipher, in the function coder. The function accepts two parameters: offset and word. The word is the input string. The offset is how many positions you will shift the word through the alphabet

The alphabet set for this kata is `{"a", "b", "c", "d", "e", "f", "g", "h", "i", "j", "k", "l", "m", "n", "o", "p", "q", "r", "s", "t", "u", "v", "w","x", "y", "z"}`

Some examples include:

`coder("Abc",1)` should return `"Bcd"`. Note that each character is shifted ONE space throughout the alphabet.

`coder("Xyz",3)` should return `"Abc"`. Characters should loop back to 'a' once they go past 'z'.

The output should retain the casing of the original letters, as seen in the examples above.
